availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Moses “Coby” Preston, Sr., and Elizabeth Haney Preston. Married to Lorendia Price Preston. Father of Paris F. Preston, George W. Preston, Samantha Preston, and Anderson B. Preston. Farmer and student in Johnson County in 1850. Farmer in Johnson County in 1860. Farmer in Johnson County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 110A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 196.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Paintsville, p. 172A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Film 994027-994058: Johnson County Births, 1857, p. 3 of 5 of microfilm.
_ Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Johnson County Wills, Vol. B-F, 1869-1975, p. 137 of 1408 of microfilm (Accessed through ancestry.com on August 5, 2020.
_Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 9th Congressional District, Johnson County, Vol. 2 of 3, October 1863, p. 294, p. 87 of 212 of microfilm), (Accessed via ancestry.com on August 4, 2020).
Find A Grave, “Montraville Preston (1832-1904)," Memorial 41461695, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/41461695 (accessed August 4, 2020).
